bwwExcerpt: Audience education is certainly on director George C. Wolfe's agenda in his eagerly anticipated, luxuriously re-upholstered revival of the early 1920s musical "Shuffle Along." In fact, the goals of correcting the record so vie for primacy with the values of first-class entertainment in this vibrant, didactic, at times breathtaking and other times slightly condescending enterprise that you sense a war still raging, over what exactly the show is striving to be...Were it not for the array of buoyan
